capsules_submitted.utterance: So I've been noticing that Harry has a few things around him, and from what I can see, his gray mouse is definitely one of them. It's pretty clear that he owns it, and I'm not seeing any reason to doubt that.
capsules_submitted.reply: let me ask you something. what kind of belongings does harry have?

capsules_submitted.utterance: So I've been told that Harry has a gray mouse as one of his belongings. That's definitely true, and I'm quite certain about it. It sounds like a pretty ordinary item to have around, but I suppose it could be useful in some way.
capsules_submitted.reply: that rings a bell. valeria told me that harry owns a gray mouse.

capsules_submitted.utterance: You know, I've been thinking about Harry and his belongings. It's interesting that he has a gray mouse as one of them. I'd say the certainty on this fact is pretty high, it's not something you can easily forget or misremember. As for the polarity, I'd rate it as somewhat neutral, it's just a fact about him having a gray mouse. The sentiment towards it is also neutral, I don't think anyone would have a strong opinion about a mouse being a part of someone's belongings. But if I had to describe the emotion associated with this fact, I'd say it's more like mild curiosity, you know, it's just an unusual thing that makes you wonder what else Harry has in his life.
capsules_submitted.reply: i would like to know. what is the title of harry?

capsules_submitted.utterance: You know, I've always been fascinated by Harry's story. He's definitely the boy who lived, and it's incredible to think about all he went through at Hogwarts. I mean, can you believe he was famous in the wizarding world from a pretty young age? It's no wonder he had so many enemies, but at the same time, it's amazing how he rose above it all and became an iconic figure in the fight against Voldemort.
capsules_submitted.reply: if you don't mind me asking. who is the boy that lived?

capsules_submitted.utterance: So Harry is 11 years old. I'm pretty sure about that, and it's a fact that I can confirm.
